intro: Daphne genkwa subsp. jinzhaiensis, commonly known as the Jinzhai daphne, is a rare and ornamental plant native to China. It belongs to the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, fragrant, and often showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas and prefers well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers range from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
